translation.text: Maaroo, Third Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: The Formless Lord created the universe of form.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: By the Hukam of His Command, He created attachment to Maya.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਆਪੇ ਖੇਲ ਕਰੇ ਸਭਿ ਕਰਤਾ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਾਚਾ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The Creator Himself stages all the plays; hearing of the True Lord, enshrine Him in your mind. ||1||

transliteration.text: āpē khēl karē sabh karatā sun sāchā mann vasāidā .1.

translation.text: Maya, the mother, gave birth to the three gunas, the three qualities,

transliteration.text: māiā māī trai gun parasūt jamāiā .

translation.text: Creating the years, months, days and dates, He infused intelligence into the world. ||2||

transliteration.text: varhē māh vār thitī kar is jag mah sōjhī pāidā .2.

text: ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਵਰਤੀ ਜਗ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਇਸੁ ਬਾਣੀ ਤੇ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The Word of the Guru's Bani prevails throughout the world; through this Bani, the Lord's Name is obtained. ||3||

transliteration.text: gurabānī varatī jag antar is bānī tē har nām pāidā .3.

text: ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾਇ ਸਦਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਏ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਗੁਣ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: In the love of duality, he suffers in pain forever; he is deluded by doubt, and confused by the three gunas. ||4||

transliteration.text: dūjai bhāi sadā dukh pāē trai gun bharam bhulāidā .4.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, one is united in the Lord's Union.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das

text: ਸਚਾ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਸਚਾ ਵਾਪਾਰਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਅਮੋਲਕੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: God is True, and True is His trade, through which the priceless Naam is obtained. ||10||

transliteration.text: sachā prabh sachā vāpārā nām amōlak pāidā .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਇਸੁ ਕਾਇਆ ਕੀ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਕਿਨੈ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: No one has found this body's value.

transliteration.text: is kāiā kī kīmat kinai n pāī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: My Lord and Master has worked His handiwork.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਸੁ ਕਾਇਆ ਸੋਧੈ ਆਪਹਿ ਆਪੁ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: One who becomes Gurmukh purifies his body, and then the Lord unites him with Himself. ||11||

transliteration.text: guramukh hōvai s kāiā sōdhai āpah āp milāidā .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਕਾਇਆ ਵਿਚਿ ਤੋਟਾ ਕਾਇਆ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਾਹਾ ॥

translation.text: Within the body, one loses, and within the body, one wins.

transliteration.text: kāiā vich tōtā kāiā vich lāhā .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: The Gurmukh seeks the self-sustaining Lord.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਣਜਿ ਸਦਾ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਏ ਸਹਜੇ ਸਹਜਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh trades, and finds peace forever; he intuitively merges in the Celestial Lord. ||12||

transliteration.text: guramukh vanaj sadā sukh pāē sahajē sahaj milāidā .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: True is the Lord's Mansion, and True is His treasure.

translation.text: The Great Giver Himself gives.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਲਾਹੇ ਸੁਖਦਾਤੇ ਮਨਿ ਮੇਲੇ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh praises the Giver of peace; his mind is united with the Lord, and he comes to know His worth. ||13||

transliteration.text: guramukh sālāhē sukhadātē man mēlē kīmat pāidā .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਕਾਇਆ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਸਤੁ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਨਹੀ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Within the body is the object; its value cannot be estimated.

transliteration.text: kāiā vich vasat kīmat nahī pāī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: He Himself grants glorious greatness to the Gurmukh.

text: ਜਿਸ ਦਾ ਹਟੁ ਸੋਈ ਵਥੁ ਜਾਣੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਦੇਇ ਨ ਪਛੋਤਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: He alone knows this object, to whom this store belongs; the Gurmukh is blessed with it, and does not come to regret. ||14||

transliteration.text: jis dā hat sōī vath jānai guramukh dēi n pashōtāidā .14.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਹਰਿ ਜੀਉ ਸਭ ਮਹਿ ਰਹਿਆ ਸਮਾਈ ॥

translation.text: The Dear Lord is pervading and permeating all.

transliteration.text: har jīu sabh mah rahiā samāī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: By Guru's Grace, He is found.

text: ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਏ ਆਪੇ ਸਬਦੇ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: He Himself unites in His Union; through the Word of the Shabad, one intuitively merges with Him. ||15||

transliteration.text: āpē mēl milāē āpē sabadē sahaj samāidā .15.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: The True Lord Himself unites us in the Word of His Shabad.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਵਡਿਆਈ ਨਾਮੇ ਹੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੬॥੮॥੨੨॥

translation.text: O Nanak, He blesses us with His Naam, and throgh the Naam, peace is found. ||16||8||22||

transliteration.text: nānak nām milai vadiāī nāmē hī sukh pāidā .16.8.22.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences.
